section.title: Development network
section.para: In this section we discuss the development network and its zones. We show the libvirt commands to create the development networks. For background information, see . The network drawing is given in . In the table below, we explain the subdivision of the network in different zones.

row.entry: The core network provides the place where we do the work. For example, the dev1 development node is located here. This node is a bare system on which we test our Puppet code. Furthermore, from a network perspective, this zone also interconnects the other zones.

The svcs network provides the network location for our basic Linux infra services, like DNS, LDAP, NTP, etc. So, whenever a new service for the development environment (dmsat1 deployment zone) is introduced, it is placed in svcs.

The rmt network is a Satellite zone where we do similar work as in the core zone. The difference is that it is a separate area. For example, it could be a different geographical location or a subsidiary.
The dmz network is a network that connects us to the Internet, or other networks that we don't control. So, a different security level is applicable here.

section.para: In this text, we show how to create the different zones on the host machine.

para.screen:
&hostp; cat core.xml <network> <name>core</name> <forward mode='nat'/> <bridge name='virbr1' stp='on' delay='0'/> <mac address='52:54:00:A8:04:01'/> <ip address='192.168.4.1' netmask='255.255.255.0'/> </network>
&hostp; virsh net-define core.xml Network core defined from core.xml &hostp; virsh net-autostart core &hostp; virsh net-start core

&hostp; cat svcs.xml <network> <name>svcs</name> <forward mode='nat'/> <bridge name='virbr2' stp='on' delay='0'/> <mac address='52:54:00:A8:05:01'/> <ip address='192.168.5.1' netmask='255.255.255.0'/> </network>
&hostp; virsh net-define svcs.xml Network svcs defined from svcs.xml &hostp; virsh net-autostart svcs &hostp; virsh net-start svcs

&hostp; cat dmz.xml <network> <name>dmz</name> <forward mode='nat'/> <bridge name='virbr3' stp='on' delay='0'/> <mac address='52:54:00:A8:06:01'/> <ip address='192.168.6.1' netmask='255.255.255.0'/> </network>
&hostp; virsh net-define dmz.xml Network dmz defined from dmz.xml &hostp; virsh net-autostart dmz &hostp; virsh net-start dmz

&hostp; cat rmt.xml <network> <name>rmt</name> <forward mode='nat'/> <bridge name='virbr4' stp='on' delay='0'/> <mac address='52:54:00:A8:07:01'/> <ip address='192.168.7.1' netmask='255.255.255.0'/> </network>
&hostp; virsh net-define rmt.xml Network rmt defined from rmt.xml &hostp; virsh net-autostart rmt &hostp; virsh net-start rmt
